basics.name: Ines Costa
basics.label: Senior School Counsellor
basics.summary: My journey in psychology began with a deep curiosity about how people think, feel, and grow. I am particularly drawn to working with students experiencing mood disorders, anxiety, and emerging personality disorders. My approach is grounded in cognitive behavioural therapy (CBT), with a strong focus on helping young people develop insight and practical strategies to manage their thoughts, emotions, and behaviours. I am committed to continued growth in the field of youth mental health and to delivering evidence-based, compassionate support for children and adolescents.

skills.name: Oral & Written Proficiency in English and Portuguese
Proficiency in Microsoft Office: Word, Excel and Powerpoint

work.name: Cadin
work.summary: Psychological intervention using a cognitive-behavioral (CBT) and integrative approach for children and adolescents with various emotional and behavioral difficulties. Intervention in mood and anxiety disorders, personality difficulties, and self-harming behaviors.

work.name: St. Dominic's International School
work.summary: Provide psychological and social–emotional support in a fast-paced, international school setting. Deliver short-term 1:1 counselling and targeted interventions for students, facilitate group sessions to build resilience and social-emotional skills, and support staff through training, consultation, and wellbeing initiatives. Act as first responder in crisis and emergency situations, ensuring student safety and wellbeing while collaborating closely with teachers, leadership, and parents to promote a supportive learning environment.

work.name: St. Dominic's International School
work.summary: Supported the school counsellor in implementing the social–emotional learning program, including planning, preparing, and delivering sessions for students. Observed and co-facilitated 1:1 counselling sessions, gradually progressing to managing independent cases under supervision. Assisted in promoting social-emotional development and wellbeing in a diverse, international school setting.

work.name: Fidelidade
work.summary: Worked in the international marketing department, ensuring all franchises adhered to corporate marketing policies and brand guidelines. Supported regional teams in developing campaigns, provided guidance on marketing strategy, and reviewed projects to maintain consistency and alignment with company standards.

work.name: Hospital Beatriz Angelo
work.summary: Shadowing psychologists in the adult Psychiatry sector. Observing Forensic, neuropsychology, liaison and external psychology appointments. Shadowing the children's psychiatric section, within the mental health unit.

work.name: Hospital da Luz
work.summary: Observing patients with attention deficit disorder (ADD), autism and other learning disabilities. Observing patients receiving a diagnosis as well as different therapy sessions such as, speech, cognitive behavioural therapy and learning support.

work.name: Cherish
work.description: Non-profit service for young adults with disabilities.
work.summary: Supporting and assisting Cherish members during their evening sessions. Ensuring all members are involved, in good spirits and taught daily life skills. Working on on a one-to-one basis during holiday schemes.

accomplishments.title: University of Brighton Volleyball Team President
accomplishments.description: Organising all administrative matters within the club. Challenging role that has improved my leadership and delegating skills. Managing the women's and men's team. Motivating teams and pushing towards a more effective committee.
